column1: In the above circumstances, it is evident that there is strong and cogent evidence that establishes
the  fact  that  the  prosecution  has  proved  its  case  beyond  reasonable  doubt  and  also  that,  it  is
proper for the learned Trial Judge to decide that, the accused-appellant did commit the offence
Considering the above, there is no reason to interfere with the findings of the learned High Court
We affirm the conviction and the sentence dated 28.09.2016.
